<ce:section-title>Compound preparation</ce:section-title><ce:section-title>[Mn<ce:sup loc="post">III</ce:sup>
<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>CC<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>CO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)(salox)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>(dmf)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>·2n(dmf) (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>·2n(dmf))</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0020" view="all">A colorless solution of terephthalic acid (0.032<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.192<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in dmf (14<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml) was added to a dark brown solution of [Mn<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>CPh)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(salox)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>(Me<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>CO)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>] (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>) (0.075<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.048<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in MeCN (18<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml). The resulting dark green–brown solution was stirred with gentle heating for 15<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min and filtered off to obtain a clear dark green–brown solution. Layer of Et<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O to the final reaction solution afforded brown prismatic crystals of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>·2<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>(dmf) after one week. Yield: 0.030 gr, ∼34%. The crystals were collected by filtration and dried in air. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3466sb, 3243wsh, 3060w, 3011w, 2927w, 1658msh, 1646vs, 1598s, 1587wsh, 1560s, 1544ssh, 1500w, 1471m, 1440s, 1413w, 1382vs, 1324w, 1284m, 1255w, 1202m, 1151m, 1124w, 1104m, 1044m, 1029s, 1004wsh, 962w, 915s, 860w, 820m, 755s, 675s, 646m, 549w, 531mb, 478m, 466m. <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">68</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">76</ce:inf>Mn<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">24</ce:inf> (1775.05): C, 46.01; H, 4.32; N, 9.47. Found: C, 45.82; H, 4.35; N, 9.42%.</ce:para><ce:section-title>Single-crystal X-ray crystallography</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0025" view="all">A brown crystal of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>·2<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>(dmf) (0.05<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>×<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>0.15<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>×<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>0.19<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mm) was taken directly from the mother liquor and immediately cooled to −93<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. Diffraction measurements were made on a Rigaku R-AXIS SPIDER Image Plate diffractometer using graphite monochromated Cu Kα radiation. Data collection (ω-scans) and processing (cell refinement, data reduction and Empirical absorption correction) were performed using the CrystalClear program package . The structure was solved by direct methods using S<ce:small-caps>helxs</ce:small-caps>-97  and refined by full-matrix least-squares techniques on <ce:italic>F</ce:italic>
<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup> with S<ce:small-caps>helxl</ce:small-caps>-97 . Important crystallographic data are listed in 
<ce:float-anchor refid="t0005"></ce:float-anchor>. Further experimental crystallographic details for <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>·2<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>(dmf): 2<ce:italic>θ</ce:italic>

<ce:inf loc="post">int</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>0.0552]/6037; 509 parameters refined; (Δ/<ce:italic>σ</ce:italic>)<ce:inf loc="post">max</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>0.001; (Δρ)<ce:inf loc="post">max</ce:inf>/(Δρ)<ce:inf loc="post">min</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>0.610/−0.671<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>e/Å<ce:sup loc="post">3</ce:sup>; <ce:italic>R</ce:italic>/<ce:italic>R</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">w</ce:inf> (for all data), 0.0707/0.1581. Hydrogen atoms were introduced at calculated positions as riding on bonded atoms. All non-H atoms were refined anisotropically. The oxygen atom of the solvate dmf molecule was found disordered and was refined over two positions with occupation factors fixed at 0.50. Plots of the structures were drawn using the Diamond 3 program package .</ce:para>
clean_text:
Compound preparation

[MnIII 6O2(O2CC6H4CO2)(salox)6(dmf)4]n⋅2n(dmf) (2⋅2n(dmf))

A colorless solution of terephthalic acid (0.032g, 0.192mmol) in dmf (14ml) was added to a dark brown solution of [Mn6O2(O2CPh)2(salox)6(Me2CO)2(H2O)2] (1) (0.075g, 0.048mmol) in MeCN (18ml). The resulting dark green-brown solution was stirred with gentle heating for 15min and filtered off to obtain a clear dark green-brown solution. Layer of Et2O to the final reaction solution afforded brown prismatic crystals of 2⋅2n(dmf) after one week. Yield: 0.030 gr, ~34%. The crystals were collected by filtration and dried in air. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3466sb, 3243wsh, 3060w, 3011w, 2927w, 1658msh, 1646vs, 1598s, 1587wsh, 1560s, 1544ssh, 1500w, 1471m, 1440s, 1413w, 1382vs, 1324w, 1284m, 1255w, 1202m, 1151m, 1124w, 1104m, 1044m, 1029s, 1004wsh, 962w, 915s, 860w, 820m, 755s, 675s, 646m, 549w, 531mb, 478m, 466m. Anal. Calc. for C68H76Mn6N12O24 (1775.05): C, 46.01; H, 4.32; N, 9.47. Found: C, 45.82; H, 4.35; N, 9.42%.

Single-crystal X-ray crystallography

A brown crystal of 2⋅2n(dmf) (0.05×0.15×0.19mm) was taken directly from the mother liquor and immediately cooled to -93°C. Diffraction measurements were made on a Rigaku R-AXIS SPIDER Image Plate diffractometer using graphite monochromated Cu Kα radiation. Data collection (ω-scans) and processing (cell refinement, data reduction and Empirical absorption correction) were performed using the CrystalClear program package . The structure was solved by direct methods using Shelxs-97  and refined by full-matrix least-squares techniques on F 2 with Shelxl-97 . Important crystallographic data are listed in  . Further experimental crystallographic details for 2⋅2n(dmf): 2θ max =130°; reflections collected/unique/used, 17660/6037 [R int =0.0552]/6037; 509 parameters refined; (Δ/σ)max =0.001; (Δρ)max/(Δρ)min =0.610/-0.671e/Å3; R/R w (for all data), 0.0707/0.1581. Hydrogen atoms were introduced at calculated positions as riding on bonded atoms. All non-H atoms were refined anisotropically. The oxygen atom of the solvate dmf molecule was found disordered and was refined over two positions with occupation factors fixed at 0.50. Plots of the structures were drawn using the Diamond 3 program package .
